verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> upon Nehiloth <WH5155>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. Give ear <WH238> to my words <WH561>, O LORD <WH3068>, consider <WH995> my meditation <WH1901>.
Hearken <WH7181> unto the voice <WH6963> of my cry <WH7773>, my King <WH4428>, and my God <WH430>: for unto thee will I pray <WH6419>.
My voice <WH6963> shalt thou hear <WH8085> in the morning <WH1242>, O LORD <WH3068>; in the morning <WH1242> will I direct <WH6186> my prayer unto thee, and will look up <WH6822>.
For thou art not a God <WH410> that hath pleasure <WH2655> in wickedness <WH7562>: neither shall evil <WH7451> dwell <WH1481> with thee.
The foolish <WH1984> shall not stand <WH3320> in thy sight <WH5869>: thou hatest <WH8130> all workers <WH6466> of iniquity <WH205>. in: Heb. before thine eyes
Thou shalt destroy <WH6> them that speak <WH1696> leasing <WH3577>: the LORD <WH3068> will abhor <WH8581> the bloody <WH1818> and deceitful <WH4820> man <WH376>. bloody: Heb. man of bloods and deceit

But as for me, I will come <WH935> into thy house <WH1004> in the multitude <WH7230> of thy mercy <WH2617>: and in thy fear <WH3374> will I worship <WH7812> toward thy holy <WH6944> temple <WH1964>. thy holy: Heb. the temple of thy holiness
Lead <WH5148> me, O LORD <WH3068>, in thy righteousness <WH6666> because of mine enemies <WH8324>; make thy way <WH1870> straight <WH3474> before my face <WH6440>. mine: Heb. those which observe me

For there is no faithfulness <WH3559> in their mouth <WH6310>; their inward <WH7130> part is very wickedness <WH1942>; their throat <WH1627> is an open <WH6605> sepulchre <WH6913>; they flatter <WH2505> with their tongue <WH3956>. faithfulness: or, stedfastness their mouth: Heb. his mouth, that is, the mouth of any of them very: Heb. wickednesses

Destroy <WH816> thou them, O God <WH430>; let them fall <WH5307> by their own counsels <WH4156>; cast them out <WH5080> in the multitude <WH7230> of their transgressions <WH6588>; for they have rebelled <WH4784> against thee. Destroy: or, Make them guilty by: or, from their counsels

But let all those that put their trust <WH2620> in thee rejoice <WH8055>: let them ever <WH5769> shout for joy <WH7442>, because thou defendest <WH5526> them: let them also that love <WH157> thy name <WH8034> be joyful <WH5970> in thee. defendest: Heb. coverest over, or, protectest them
For thou, LORD <WH3068>, wilt bless <WH1288> the righteous <WH6662>; with favour <WH7522> wilt thou compass <WH5849> him as with a shield <WH6793>. compass: Heb. crown
